Welcome CONTENT!  from roofs of fretted gold,</br>From Persian sofa's, and the gems of Ind,</br>From courts, and camps, and crouds,</br>Fled to my cottage mean!
Meek Virgin, wilt thou deign with me to sit</br>In pensive pleasure by my glimmering fire,</br>And with calm smile despise</br>The loud world's distant din;
As from the piny mountain's topmost cliff,</br>Some wandering hermit sage hears unconcern'd,</br>Far in the vale below</br>The thund'ring torrent burst!
Teach me, good heaven, the gilded chains of vice</br>To break, to study independent ease,</br>Pride, pomp, and power to shun,</br>Those fatal Sirens fair,
That, rob'd like Eastern queens, sit on high thrones,</br>And beckoning every thirsty traveller,</br>Their baleful cups present</br>With pleasing poisons fraught.
O let me dwell in life's low valley, blest</br>With the dear Nymph I love, true, heart-felt joy,</br>With chosen friends to turn</br>The polish'd Attic page;
Nor seldom, if nor Fortune damp my wings,</br>Nor dire Disease, to soar to PINDUS' hill,</br>My hours, my soul devote,</br>To Poesy and Love!</br>
